attributes.action: allow music videos to be shown on YouTube in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
YouTube is the primary source for listening to new and old music videos for many British citizens. By removing these videos from the UK YouTube site, many people will not be able to listen to new music, meaning less publicity for the musicians. Worst case scenario, the public will download increased amounts of music illegally, is this really the way new music is headed?

We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister, YouTube, PROs, and the British music industry to allow music videos to be shown in our free country.

rejection.details: This is a purely commerical matter between Google, as owners of Youtube, and the relevant licensing bodies.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
